intro: Tricalysia negrosensis, commonly known as the Negros trumpetwood, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, with dark green, elliptical leaves. It produces yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
